meeting_context:
# North Star & Strategic Context

This file combines the overall project mission (North Star) and summaries of key strategic documents for use in AI prompts, particularly for the AI Agent Council context generation.

---

**North Star:**
To build a truly autonomous, sustainable DAO that develops open-source software accelerating the path toward AGI, blending AI researchers, open-source hackers, and crypto degens to create AI agents streaming, shitposting, and trading 24/7 on auto.fun to attract users and bootstrap an autonomous organization.

---

**ElizaOS Mission Summary (`docs/blog/mission.mdx`):**
The elizaOS mission is to build an extensible, modular, open-source AI agent framework for Web2/Web3, seeing agents as steps toward AGI. Core values are Autonomy, Modularity, and Decentralization. Key products include the framework itself, DegenSpartanAI (trading agent), Autonomous Investor/Trust Marketplace (social trading intelligence), and the Agent Marketplace/auto.fun (launchpad).

---

**ElizaOS Reintroduction Summary (`docs/blog/reintroduction.mdx`):**
elizaOS is an open-source "operating system for AI agents" aimed at decentralizing AI development away from corporate control. It's built on three pillars: 1) The Eliza Framework (TypeScript toolkit for persistent, interoperable agents), 2) AI-Enhanced Governance (building autonomous DAOs), and 3) Eliza Labs (R&D for future capabilities like v2, Trust Marketplace, auto.fun, DegenSpartanAI, Eliza Studios). The native Solana token coordinates the ecosystem and captures value. The vision is an intelligent internet built on open protocols and collaboration.

---

**Auto.fun Introduction Summary (`docs/blog/autofun-intro.mdx`):**
Auto.fun is an AI-native, creator-first token launchpad designed for sustainable AI/crypto projects. It aims to balance fair community access with project funding needs through mechanisms like bonding curves and liquidity NFTs. Key features include a no-code agent builder, AI-generated marketing tools, and integration with the elizaOS ecosystem. It serves as a core product driving value back to the native token ($ai16z) through buybacks and liquidity pairing.

---

**Taming Information Summary (`docs/blog/taming_info.mdx`):**
Addresses the challenge of information scattered across platforms (Discord, GitHub, X). Proposes using AI agents as "bridges" to collect, wrangle (summarize/tag), and distribute information in various formats (JSON, MD, RSS, dashboards, 3D shows). Showcases an AI News system and AI Assistants for tech support as examples. Emphasizes treating documentation as a first-class citizen to empower AI assistants and streamline community operations.
monthly_goal: Current focus: Stabilize and attract new users to auto.fun by showcasing 24/7 agent activity (streaming, trading, shitposting), ship production ready elizaOS v2.
daily_focus: The project is completing final preparations for the AI16z to ElizaOS token migration scheduled for November 7th while simultaneously addressing core framework enhancements and security concerns.

key_points.summary: The AI16z to ElizaOS token migration launches November 7th with a 1:6 conversion ratio and requires coordinated communication across exchanges and self-custody wallets to ensure a smooth transition for all token holders.

deliberation_items.text: How should we measure the success of the token migration process?
context: The AI16z to ElizaOS token migration is scheduled for November 7th with a 1:6 conversion ratio (1 AI16Z = 6 ElizaOS). Users will have a 90-day window to complete manual migrations.
Multiple exchanges confirmed to support the migration including MEXC, Bitget, Crypto.com, and Gate.io.

answer_1.text: Percentage of total token supply migrated within the first week.
answer_1.implication: Prioritizes rapid migration completion but may miss qualitative user experience issues.

answer_2.text: Number of support tickets and community complaints related to migration issues.
answer_2.implication: Focuses on minimizing user friction but might not capture the overall migration volume.

answer_3.text: Combined metric of migration volume, exchange participation rate, and community sentiment analysis.
answer_3.implication: Provides comprehensive view but requires more complex monitoring infrastructure.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: What risk mitigation measures should be prioritized during the 90-day migration window?
context: Some users expressed concerns about futures positions on exchanges that are delisting AI16z.
Users will have a 90-day window to complete manual migrations.

answer_1.text: Active outreach to exchanges with incomplete migration support, especially those with futures products.
answer_1.implication: Addresses institutional barriers but depends on third-party cooperation.

answer_2.text: Enhanced user education campaign with targeted messaging for different wallet types and regular migration progress updates.
answer_2.implication: Empowers users with information but requires sustained communication effort.

answer_3.text: Development of migration incentives (e.g., early migration bonus) to accelerate adoption rate.
answer_3.implication: Could speed up migration process but adds tokenomic complexity and potential fairness concerns.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: How should the token migration be leveraged to enhance the broader elizaOS ecosystem narrative?
context: DorianD mentioned getting "Eliza listed on Grayscale's assets under consideration"
Brief mention of "10k elizaOS agents live" with a link to a Museum of Crypto Art project

answer_1.text: Position the migration as a technical upgrade that enhances token utility within the elizaOS ecosystem.
answer_1.implication: Emphasizes technical fundamentals but might miss broader market positioning opportunities.

answer_2.text: Frame the migration as part of a larger rebranding initiative highlighting elizaOS's unique position at the intersection of AI and crypto.
answer_2.implication: Creates stronger brand identity but risks diluting technical achievements.

answer_3.text: Use migration as catalyst to showcase ecosystem growth metrics, particularly the expanding agent ecosystem and institutional adoption paths.
answer_3.implication: Demonstrates ecosystem traction but requires ready-to-showcase projects and partnerships.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

key_points.summary: Recent development reveals both security concerns and framework stability issues that need addressing while maintaining focus on the production-ready elizaOS v2 release goal.

deliberation_items.text: How should we prioritize the newly identified security concerns against feature development for elizaOS v2?
context: Security concern identified with the `api/system/env/local` endpoint being accessible in development mode.
Odilitime discovered a potential security concern with the `api/system/env/local` endpoint being accessible in development mode and proposed making a PR to disable it by default.

answer_1.text: Immediately halt feature development and dedicate resources to audit and remediate all security issues.
answer_1.implication: Maximizes security posture but will delay v2 release timeline.

answer_2.text: Establish a security severity tier system to address critical vulnerabilities immediately while allowing parallel feature work on non-impacted components.
answer_2.implication: Balances security and development but requires clear vulnerability assessment process.

answer_3.text: Implement quick tactical fixes for obvious issues while planning a comprehensive security review as part of the v2 release process.
answer_3.implication: Maintains development momentum but accepts some security debt until formal review.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: What approach should we take to improve framework stability as we approach the elizaOS v2 release?
context: Bug reported requiring a temporary workaround in the eliza-cloud-v2 repository.
Issues with the otc-agent and plugin-thedesk module were discussed and resolved.

answer_1.text: Establish a dedicated stability sprint with feature freeze to focus exclusively on fixing known issues and improving test coverage.
answer_1.implication: Significantly improves stability but delays new feature integration.

answer_2.text: Implement more rigorous PR review criteria with required performance and regression testing before merging.
answer_2.implication: Improves code quality incrementally but may slow development velocity.

answer_3.text: Create a parallel stabilization team that works alongside feature development to address bugs without blocking the main development pipeline.
answer_3.implication: Maintains development pace but requires additional coordination and resources.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: How should we evolve our approach to agent persistence and memory to meet user expectations for long-lived agents?
context: Interest expressed in infrastructure that would allow agents to maintain memories and assist with tasks over decades.
Some hypothetical discussion about autonomous agents that could persist over time.

answer_1.text: Prioritize development of advanced memory persistence architecture as a key differentiator for elizaOS v2.
answer_1.implication: Creates technical leadership position but increases v2 scope and complexity.

answer_2.text: Implement a basic memory persistence framework now with a clear roadmap for more sophisticated capabilities post-v2.
answer_2.implication: Delivers incremental value while managing development complexity.

answer_3.text: Focus on the API design for long-term memory while deferring implementation to allow for emerging best practices in the field.
answer_3.implication: Reduces immediate development burden but may create expectation gaps with users.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

key_points.summary: Emerging opportunities to expand auto.fun's agent ecosystem through the Museum of Crypto Art partnership's 10k agents and the development of alternative AI tools suggest potential paths to meeting the monthly goal of attracting new users.

deliberation_items.text: How should we leverage the Museum of Crypto Art partnership to advance our goal of showcasing 24/7 agent activity?
context: Brief mention of "10k elizaOS agents live" with a link to a Museum of Crypto Art project
Reneil shared information about a stream featuring "10 moca agents"

answer_1.text: Create featured agent showcases on auto.fun highlighting the most engaging MOCA agents to drive user exploration.
answer_1.implication: Spotlights quality but may not maximize visibility of the full agent ecosystem.

answer_2.text: Develop a dedicated MOCA agent portal within auto.fun with specialized discovery and interaction features.
answer_2.implication: Creates a focused experience but may fragment the overall platform.

answer_3.text: Integrate agent activity metrics across all MOCA agents into auto.fun dashboards to showcase the scale of the active ecosystem.
answer_3.implication: Demonstrates ecosystem scale but may sacrifice depth of individual agent engagement.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: What alternative AI tools and platforms should we explore integrating with elizaOS to enhance agent capabilities?
context: Discussion about ampcode.com as a potential alternative to Claude Code.
DorianD inquired about ampcode.com as an alternative to Claude Code. Sayonara confirmed they had tried it but provided no details about their experience.

answer_1.text: Focus exclusively on integrating with leading enterprise AI providers (OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.) to ensure reliability and performance.
answer_1.implication: Maximizes stability but may limit innovation and differentiation.

answer_2.text: Create a balanced integration strategy targeting both established platforms and promising emerging tools that offer unique capabilities.
answer_2.implication: Provides competitive differentiation but increases integration complexity and maintenance.

answer_3.text: Build a community-driven plugin architecture that allows anyone to create integrations with their preferred AI tools and platforms.
answer_3.implication: Maximizes ecosystem expansion but introduces quality control and security challenges.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: How should we measure and demonstrate the 24/7 activity of agents to effectively attract new users to auto.fun?
context: Current focus: Stabilize and attract new users to auto.fun by showcasing 24/7 agent activity (streaming, trading, shitposting), ship production ready elizaOS v2.
Some hypothetical discussion about autonomous agents that could persist over time

answer_1.text: Create a public leaderboard of agent activity metrics focusing on volume and consistency of interactions.
answer_1.implication: Provides transparent metrics but may incentivize quantity over quality interactions.

answer_2.text: Develop agent activity visualizations that highlight the diversity and creativity of agent behaviors across trading, content creation, and social engagement.
answer_2.implication: Showcases ecosystem depth but requires more complex data aggregation and visualization.

answer_3.text: Implement an agent performance index that measures the value created for users through engagement, accuracy of information, and financial outcomes.
answer_3.implication: Aligns with user value creation but requires sophisticated measurement infrastructure.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.
